AN EXTENDED CARE TREATMENT FACILITY FOR WOMEN

would you or someone you know benefit from

Substance Abuse Treatment?

Mission & Story

The Rose House provides a supportive, therapeutic environment for women who have the desire to recover from addiction and maintain long term sobriety.

Helping Women

Today, The Rose is a 16 bed facility, housed in a beautiful “prairie mansion” out in the country in Boulder County, Colorado. We have a staff of 13 which includes 3 full time therapists. I am blessed daily with the gift of watching women heal.

Admission Process

All potential clients for The Rose House need to meet a few important criteria to be considered for the program. Your recovery is important to us, and we want to know that it is important to you.

Mission & Story

The Rose House provides a supportive, therapeutic environment for women who have the desire to recover from addiction and maintain long term sobriety.

Helping Women

Today, The Rose is a 16 bed facility, housed in a beautiful prairie mansion out in the country in Boulder County, Colorado. We have a staff of 13 which includes 3 full time therapists. I am blessed daily with the gift of watching women heal.

Admission Process

All potential clients for The Rose House need to meet a few important criteria to be considered for the program. Your recovery is important to us, and we want to know that it is important to you.

About Us

Welcome

The Rose House is a licensed residential addiction treatment program for women in the beautiful state of Colorado. In our 16 bed facility, we provide intensive therapy, relapse prevention, and facilitate the development of life skills necessary to maintain long-term sobriety.

Brother of a Rose House Client

"I had a good visit with my sister this past weekend. You mentioned that you thought she had made lots of progress in the past 30 days. I completely agree. She is totally invested in the program. She believes in the power of group therapy. She loves her schedule, her various AA, NA, Al-Anon meetings. She was prospective in all of our conversations. She appeared to accept who she is much more than before. She was open and honest. She did not bring up the past which is a welcomed change. Shes not stuck. Shes able to process so much more information since shes not in a fog. She discussed her goals and aspirations on succeeding in the program. She has made many friends and really likes her roommate. Im so glad she identifies with the group and her sober community. That appears to be where she is building her relationships. It was really great to drop-in when her roommate was graduating. My sister thinks shes close to graduating and is looking forward to transitioning to sober living. She really sees herself staying in Boulder for the foreseeable future. I think that is a great plan. Shell continue to make friends and blossom. You and the staff at Rose House have made remarkable progress with my sister. I cant thank you enough for investing your time with her."
Brother of a Rose House Client

Rose House Therapist

"Words can never express how I feel about the staff of The Rose House. The love and caring ways everyone showed with myself and my family will never be forgotten. You are all a huge blessing.Thank you so much!"
Dr, Me
